body: can you try the agent for `v6.1.0`,I have fixed the same issue in `spring-annotation-plugin` in `v6.1.0`
Yes. Spring plugin should be fixed. I remember we have changed the mode.

at com.rrjc.pay.ext.facade.mq.RiskSender.send(RiskSender.java) ~[pay-ext-facade-2.3.3.jar:?]

According to this log, look like you have built a new plugin? Or using some toolkit?`com.rrjc.pay.ext.facade.mq.RiskSender.send` should not be enhanced by SkyWalking, except for toolkit or Spring annotation plugin.

Could you share the `com.rrjc.pay.ext.facade.mq.RiskSender` with us? And how you are using it?

same problem happened to me，i run sky server in docker， but run agent in my windows。can i use it by this way？
没有，我想应该不是es的问题，我的es接入了logstash和kibana都很正常
FYI es 6.2.4 has this issue
You could follow agent setup document to set UUID manually, then the instance name wouldn't change. But the side effect will be, the PID most likely would be wrong.

> same problem happened to me，i run sky server in docker， but run agent in my windows。can i use it by this way？

Any way you like, just make sure the network is connectable.

I had met the same issue
Actually the Root Cause is the lack of services info. UI don't identify any services
Like me I found the reason is that **the UI uses UTC+8 while the datetime of oap machine uses UTC, therefore you CAN NOT find any service from ui** 
and when you try to find get info by ui, ui brings no any service Id and oap reports IDs cant be null

Sorry But I just did it as the skywlking official document [How to build](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/guides/How-to-build.md) Is there any othe problems possible that cause it. I have try it in centos and ubuntu . The same problem
Your logs indicate you didn't follow the document, because the classes you missed should be downloaded when you run `git submodule ***`, or already included in Apache source release.
Ok I just thought **git submodule**  will not be neccessary If follow the second part Build from Apache source code release. Thank you for your advice

If you build from Apache source code, it is not necessary. But I think you misunderstand what is Apache source codes. Download from here http://skywalking.apache.org/downloads/ is Apache release, not from GitHub.
GitHub is just mirror of Apache git, so the official release of source codes or convenient binary are all not there.

Here is the [test report](http://github.com/SkywalkingTest/agent-integration-test-report/tree/master/2019/5/dmsolr/testReport-master-2019-05-24-13-51.md) and [validate logs](http://35.227.88.23:49001/job/skywalking-agent-test/99/artifact/workspace/logs/validate_2019-05-24-13-51.log)

> If you build from Apache source code, it is not necessary. But I think you misunderstand what is Apache source codes. Download from here http://skywalking.apache.org/downloads/ is Apache release, not from GitHub.

No I just download src.tar.gz from 
http://mirror.bit.edu.cn/apache/skywalking/6.1.0/apache-skywalking-apm-6.1.0-src.tgz

If you download there, there is no need to run `git submodule`. You need to check the maven to log to see what happens. All source release has been built by multiple people also checked by CI, especially at Mac and Linux.

> If you download there, there is no need to run `git submodule`. You need to check the maven to log to see what happens. All source release has been built by multiple people also checked by CI, especially at Mac and Linux.

Thank you for your patience. I also think it may be the maven problem. I will figure it out
Run `./mvnw` instead of `mvn`.
If that still fails, then you may face network or JDK version issue.
Duplicate with #2633

I has find the problem. the problem is in org.apache.skywalking.apm.plugin.mongodb.v3.MongoDBMethodInterceptor#onConstruct method.
if mongodb driver version 3.2.x.
the code cluster.getDescription().getServerDescriptions() will throw java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.mongodb.connection.ClusterDescription.getServerDescriptions()Ljava/util/List
because  ClusterDescription.getServerDescriptions() is since mongodb driver 3.3

Yes. Like I said, from the supported list, we haven't supported in 3.2.x, if you want, I think you need set a pull request to add a new plugin, also add witness class for the current plugin to avoid this error.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33591843/58308026-fc6d5900-7e32-11e9-926d-fe08ba021933.png)
I use cluster.getDescription().getAll() and it works fine
sorry I didn't look carefully.thank for your answering
